results.name: Pyramidal sequence: distance to nearest product of two consecutive integers (promic or heteromecic numbers).
comment: Table A049581 T(n,k) = |n-k| read by sides of squares from T(1,n) to T(n,n), then from T(n,n) to T(n,1). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Jan 29 2013
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Boris Putievskiy, Transformations [of] Integer Sequences And Pairing Functions arXiv:1212.2732 [math.CO], 2012.
Index entries for sequences related to distance to nearest element of some set
formula: Let u(1)=1, u(n) = n - u(n-sqrtint(n)) (cf. A037458); then a(0)=0 and for n > 0 a(n) = 2*u(n) - n. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 22 2002
a(0)=0 then a(n) = floor(sqrt(n)) - a(n - floor(sqrt(n))). - _Benoit Cloitre_, May 03 2004
a(n) = |A196199(n)|. a(n) = |n - t^2 - t|, where t = floor(sqrt(n)). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Jan 29 2013 [corrected by _Ridouane Oudra_, May 11 2019]
a(n) = A000194(n) - A053188(n) = t - |t^2 - n|, where t = floor(sqrt(n)+1/2). - _Ridouane Oudra_, May 11 2019
